page.title: 05WOLD NEWTON VILLAGE (CONT)
page.content: There was thunder in the distance but the sound of the meteorite's landing caused great alarm in the area. A local magistrate, Edward Topham, lived nearby and the landing was seen by his shepherd and a farmhand. The meteorite landed within 150 yards of the former and the farmhand, John Shipley, was hit by the scattered soil and stones. The impact made a hole 100cm wide and 50cm deep. Mr.Topham had the meteorite removed from the hole, weighed and measured. It originally weighed 56 pounds but pieces were removed for investigation and merely as gifts to friends and authors. The main bulk of the meteorite can be seen in Natural History Museum in London. Mr Topham erected an obelisk on the site of the landing.
